AnswerNodes.title: The writer uses quotation marks to signal words taken from the original source but fails to include a citation acknowledging the source.
The writer includes a passage of text from the original source without including any attribution at all, i.e., no quotation marks or citation.

The writer includes a passage of text from the original source and includes a correct citation (author's name, year of publications, page, para. #) but fails to use quotation marks around the borrowed words.
The writer includes words and information that did not appear in the original source, but claims that she did by using quotation marks and providing a citation.
The writer correctly quotes and cites a passage of text from the original source.
